Different-types-to-write-a-function_key1: name: Different types to write a function
Different-types-to-write-a-function_key3: Earlier in this tutorial, you learned that functions are declared with the following `syntax`:
Different-types-to-write-a-function_key5: We can call a function with a name, like addNumbers above, any time we need it by referencing its name and passing some arguments to it. This function has a name. Named functions are useful if we need to call a function many times to pass different values to it or run it several times.
Different-types-to-write-a-function_key7: Here we have just declared the function getSum. We havenâ€™t called it yet. Declared functions are not `execute`d immediately. They are "`save`d for later use", and will be `execute`d later, when they are invoked (called upon).
Different-types-to-write-a-function_key8: Notice how in the function declaration above we will declare function by writing a function and do the tasks, but in function expressions we will assign to it a `variable` and perform tasks.
Different-types-to-write-a-function_key9: The `syntax` that we've used before to create functions is called function declaration. There is another `syntax` for creating a function that is called a function expression. A function expression can be stored in a `variable`:
Different-types-to-write-a-function_key1: Functions stored in `variables` do not need function names. They are always invoked (called) using the `variable` name.
The function above is actually an anonymous function (a function without a name).
Define an Anonymous function and call it by taking two arguments to whether they are       equal or not?
You have to add parentheses around the function to indicate that it is a function expression:

As we see in the example, we are not giving names and not storing the function in any `variable`. We are declaring it after that we are accessing it using parentheses. So, `output` is showing Hello!! Nayak
Different-types-to-write-a-function_key2:
A self-invoking expression is invoked (started) automatically, without being called.
Function expressions will `execute` automatically if the expression is followed by ().
You cannot self-invoke a function declaration.
1.Define an Self invoking function and call it by taking two arguments to whether they are  equal or not?
